basics.name: Sushruth Sastry
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary: Frontend Platform Engineer with 12+ years of experience building infrastructure that scales engineering organizations. I design monorepo architectures, micro-frontend platforms, and CI/CD systems that enable hundreds of engineers to ship reliably. Track record of modernizing legacy codebases at Microsoft and DocuSign while maintaining production stability.

work.name: DocuSign, Inc.
work.summary: Feature owner for select platform capabilities and contributor to frontend infrastructure used by 440+ engineers. Operate at platform scope—designing systems that accelerate delivery for multiple product teams.
highlights: Created the 1DS micro-frontend framework used internally across DocuSign, and open-sourced it as 1FE (github.com/docusign/1fe), enabling configuration-driven frontend composition.
Designed a monorepo CI/CD architecture on Azure DevOps that enabled atomic multi-package releases, drastically reducing integration failures from uncoordinated deployments.

Built the Scenes feature—a live, in-place Storybook replacement for micro-frontends across the DocuSign website, enabling API and property mocking. Reduced dev churn during parallel API/UI development and let stakeholders see progress without manual mock setup. Now used by 6 teams.
Shipped a shared component variant strategy adopted by 16 production applications, eliminating the need for duplicate implementations and enforcing design system consistency.
Delivered Maestro workflow features and built internal tooling that auto-maps Figma tokens to design system values, reducing manual design-to-code translation errors.

work.name: Microsoft Corporation
work.summary: Frontend lead on a Teams product integrating into Admin Center. Drove Module Federation adoption, build modernization, and developer experience improvements for the project.
highlights: Pioneered the setup of Webpack 5 Module Federation in Teams Admin Center, enabling independent feature deployment and cutting local dev loop time from minutes to under 60 seconds.

Migrated build infrastructure to Webpack 5 and Yarn PnP across several projects with a coworker, reducing build times and eliminating intermittent CI failures caused by dependency resolution overloading the Node.js package proxy.
Built and maintained the graph-js library for MS Graph API consumption—fully type-safe with automatic typing from OData schemas. Adopted as the standard across all teams in the broader organization.
Owned the Visits analytics dashboard frontend, delivering healthcare usage metrics for organizations using Epic EHR integration with Teams.
Maintained 6 shared packages in a JS tooling monorepo (graph-js, graph-based user picker, etc.), all with strict TypeScript typing.

work.name: Microsoft Corporation
highlights: Designed the Setup Wizard framework for Teams Admin Center—became the standard onboarding pattern adopted by subsequent features.
Shipped the Epic–Teams healthcare integration frontend, enabling clinical staff to launch Teams meetings directly from Epic EHR workflows.
Built the team's first shared libraries: an OData-to-TypeScript generator and typed MS Graph wrappers that automated API contract maintenance.

work.name: CVS Health
highlights: Led the AngularJS-to-Angular 2+ migration for the CareGiver platform, delivering a maintainable architecture that supported continued feature development.
Built a RequireJS dependency generator that automated configuration and eliminated a class of manual integration errors.

work.name: Heartland Payment Systems
highlights: Evaluated mobile architectures (React Native vs Angular hybrid), delivering prototypes that informed the team's technology decision.
Modernized backend from PHP 5 to PHP 7, improving runtime performance and closing security vulnerabilities.

key_differentiators.summary: Why hire me as a Principal/Lead Engineer

points.detail: I build infrastructure that makes entire teams faster. At DocuSign, my platform work impacts 440+ engineers. I operate at organizational scope, not just individual contribution.
I turn risky legacy migrations into incremental, low-risk transitions. Micro-frontends and Module Federation let me modernize systems while keeping production stable and feature work unblocked.
Architecture choices should pay off. Faster builds, shorter dev loops, fewer integration failures—I measure success by whether engineers ship faster and ops costs go down.
